TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EasingVectorKeyFrame extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.VectorKeyFrame

Docs.summary: A class that enables you to associate easing functions with a key frame animation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class is used as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.VectorKeyFrameCollection> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.VectorAnimationUsingKeyFrames> to animate a <xref:System.Windows.Vector> property value along a set of key frames. This <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.VectorKeyFrame> interpolates between the <xref:System.Windows.Vector> value of the previous key frame and its own value linearly with an easing function to produce its output value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the derived class. When creating a derived class, you must override this method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Animation classes inherit indirectly from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>. Because of this, you need to override the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BackEase.CreateInstanceCore%2A> method to construct a custom animation object.
## Examples The following example shows a typical implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CreateInstanceCore%2A>.
[!code-csharp[freezablesample_procedural#CreateInstanceCoreExample](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/freezablesample_procedural/CSharp/freezablesample.cs#createinstancecoreexample)] [!code-vb[freezablesample_procedural#CreateInstanceCoreExample](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/freezablesample_procedural/visualbasic/freezablesample.vb#createinstancecoreexample)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the easing function applied to the key frame.
Docs.value: The easing function applied to the key frame.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty EasingFunctionProperty
protected override System.Windows.Vector InterpolateValueCore (System.Windows.Vector baseValue, double keyFrameProgress);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Vector InterpolateValueCore(valuetype System.Windows.Vector baseValue, float64 keyFrameProgress) cil managed

Docs.param: A value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, that specifies the percentage of time that has elapsed for this key frame.
Docs.summary: Interpolates, according to the easing function used, between the previous key frame value and the value of the current key frame, using the supplied progress increment.
Docs.returns: The output value of this key frame given the specified base value and progress.
